title: Object-Oriented Programming Concepts
subject: Java
learning_objectives: Pillars of OOP (Inheritance, Polymorphism, Encapsulation, Abstraction)
theory:
OOP maps code to real-world things.

**The 4 Pillars**:
1.  **Encapsulation**: Hiding data (Capsule).
2.  **Inheritance**: Parent-Child relationship (Is-A).
3.  **Polymorphism**: One name, many forms.
4.  **Abstraction**: Hiding implementation details.

examples.code:
// Car is a Class (Blueprint)
// My Ferrari is an Object (Instance)

common_mistakes.correction: Classes depending too heavily on each other. OOP strives for Loose Coupling.

practice_problems.problem: Name the pillar: Protecting data with private.

real_world_use_cases.description: Entity -> Player, Entity -> Enemy. Shared logic in Entity.

exam_notes: Object is the parent of all classes.
Simula was the first OOP language.
summary: OOP is the heart of Java.
